bibl.title: Philae and the End of Ancient Egyptian Religion. A Regional Study of Religious Transformation (298-642 CE). (Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 173.)
bibl.biblScope: 1 arbre généal., 1 graphique, 16 pll. (figg., cartes, plans).
bibl.note: Diss. Univ. of Groningen, 2005. - Preface. - General Introduction: Setting the Scene. - Part I. The Expansion of Christianity in the Region of the First Cataract in Late Antiquity. - Part II. The Contraction of the Ancient Egyptian Cults at Philae in the Fourth and Fifth Centuries. - Part III. The Making of a Christian Philae in the Sixth Century. - General Conclusion. - Appendices. Select Bibliography. Indices.
